Tucson's main concern was the saftey of his comrades.  He would gladly take=
 the damage to protect his own.  He knew the urgency of their plight to lea=
ve, and he would definitely allow himself to be taken out of there, seeing =
that it meant to keep precious lives safe from harm.  He didn't care if he =
did not bring down Hydras.  He saw what was most important, it was all arou=
nd him, his comrades, their saftey, and the fact that together they worked =
very hard to get where they were now.  It was what separated him from Hydra=
s.  Neither angry or upset, rather more grateful than anything else, he too=
 first responds to Talon.

" Talon, you - took great risks for me.  I can n=
ever - repay you enough for your bravery, and compassion.  We - may not hav=
e taken Hydras this day, but we worked very hard together and we did cover =
- a mile stone.    And I will gladly take the full force of damage, if it i=
s to protect you and the others."

Night Shift now rigs a towe line on Tucs=
on, with several hooks and dashes over to Kup and the others.

"Okay guys, =
I got some towe lines here, and as long as Tucson's in neutral, we can towe=
 'em back ta the ark.  It's a lot easier gettn' 'em back in alt mode, than =
in his robot mode.  At least this way he can roll on his tires which will t=
ake most of the weight.  All I need is some volunteers, besides Kup and mys=
elf."

Tucson now sends a message to his comrades.

" Fellow Maximals and A=
utobots, I want you to know - that your efforts here today, are gladly appr=
eciated, and even if - things did not work accordingly, all that is importa=
nt, is that we are all making it back safely.  I thank each and every one o=
f you for your efforts, and I - admit, I may have miscalculated a few thing=
s.  In any event, I am proud of all of you and honored to have each and eve=
ry soldier serving our factions."

He sends a message back to Legacy.  

"L=
egacy, I - thought things over a bit.  If - you had any intentions - of cau=
sing harm, you - would have started with me directly.  But that did - not c=
ome about.  I have misjudged you, therefore I revoke any alligations I had =
against you.  So it is with this in - mind that I trust the duty of finding=
 the individual responsible for framing you, in your capable hands.  Once -=
 you find them, bring them to me.  I appologize for my assumptions."

Outsi=
de, Rat Trap holds onto Windlord tightly as he gets Tucson's message.  He w=
as happy to hear his voice once again.

"Hear that Windlord?  Wheels is gon=
na be okay.  Now, we gotta clear this parameter in a hurry."
